New Records: Sybrand Engelbrecht scored 70 runs for the Netherlands in the match.
Logan van Beek scored 59 runs for the Netherlands in the match.
Sadeera Samarawickrama scored 91* runs for Sri Lanka in the match.

Kusal Mendis-led Sri Lanka registered their first win in the ongoing ICC Men's ODI World Cup 2023 at Ekana Sports City in Lucknow, when they defeated the Netherlands by 5 wickets with 10 balls remaining.
Key Match Events: Netherlands batted first and scored 262 in 49.5 overs.

Sri Lanka lost three wickets at very short intervals, but Pathum Nissanka (54), Sadeera Samarawickrama (91*) and Charith Asalanka (44) made some quality partnership, that led Sri Lanka to a 5-wickets victory against The Netherlands.
Sri Lanka successfully chased 263-runs target in 48.2 overs and registered their first win in the ongoing ICC Men's ODI World Cup.
Dhananjaya de Silva hits two SIXes to van Beek in the 46th over.
Asalanka OUT. Aryan Dutt strikes in his final over and dismisses Asalanka.
Nissanka OUT, SL at 104-3 in 17 overs.
Half century for Nissanka, SL at 96/2 in 15 overs.
Pre-Game Insights: The Netherlands and Sri Lanka have played 5 One-Day Internationals (ODIs) so far, with the Dutch failing to defeat Sri Lanka even once.
When these teams met earlier in July 2023, Sri Lanka won by 128 runs.
Post-Match Reflections: Sadeera Samarawickrama was chosen as the player of the match.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Dutch team, in their previous match, produced the tournament's second significant shock by defeating South Africa by 38 runs on October 17.
Sri Lanka moved a position up in the ICC points tally and is at number 9 with 2 points.
Despite winning against the Dutch team, they are below it, due to Net Run Rate (NRR) difference.
